intro: Macaranga porrecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf macaranga, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptic to ovate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on short pedicels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Macaranga porrecta is also notable for its ability to form symbiotic relationships with certain species of ants.
